attributes.action: suggest to the Financial Services Authority that they refund the £1,000,000 fine levied against Nationwide Building Society for data protection failures and instead instruct that the fine be paid by those responsible rather than the societies Mutual members
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: A laptop was lost or stolen from a Nationwide employee containing confidential client data. Instead of imposing a fine against those responsible, the FSA fined Nationwide Building Society itself. Nationwide being a mutual (i.e. owned by it's depositers), this fine therefore was effectively a fine against those whose data was lost, rather than those who had committed the mistake!
